title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: He was sent very early to the public school at Haddington, from whence, at the age of fourteen, he was removed to the University of Edinburgh, where he remained  seven years; at the expiry of which period, he was licensed to preach the gospel. It was proposed to nominate him assistant and successor to his father, in the parish of Yester, but this appointment  he declined, and accepted of the church of Beith in Ayrshire. Whilst there, during the rebellion 1 745-6, he took an active part in support of the reigning family, — he not only preached against the Jacobites, but, to evince his zeal, marched from Beith to Glasgow at the head of the militia, and was made prisoner by the rebels.

title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: He was born on the 5th day of Feb. 1722, his father being then minister of the parish of Yester, about 18 miles from Edinburgh. He was sent very early to the public school at Haddington, from whence, at the age of fourteen, he was removed to the University of Edinburgh, where he remained  seven years; at the expiry of which period, he was licensed to preach the gospel.
